name: wind turbine construction, small-scale, 6kW, onshore | wind turbine, small-scale, 6kW, onshore | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/28357/documentation

This dataset represents the construction of a small-scale wind turbine with a capacity of 6 kW for onshore use. The term "wind turbine" inludes moving parts such as nacelle, rotor, rotor blades, transition piece as well as fixed parts such as the tower and the foundation. The dataset contains the manufacturing, installation, decomissioning and waste treatment of a small-scale wind turbine with described specifications:;•	horizontal-axis technology, three rotor blades;•	nominal power output 6 kW;•	direct-driven permanent magnet generator;•	total weight of the small-scale wind turbine: 180 kg (excluding electric and electronic equipment, tower and foundation);•	tower height 18m with reinforced concrete foundation;;Figure sources:;Drawing of the tower:;Submitted by manufacturer, edited to hide technical specifications.;Picture: Jüttemann, Patrick. Kleinwind-Marktreport 2020 (6. Auflage). verlagsfreie Publikation, Bad Honnef, 2020, page 124. Edited to hide brand name on the turbine.

From the transformation of pasture land to industrial site, and from the reception and treatment of building materials and turbine parts.

This activity ends with the decommissioning of the wind turbine and the treatment of the resulting materials in the end of the lifetime.
This dataset includes:
•	all materials for the construction of the wind turbine, their assembly and their treatment
•	land transformation and use
•	energy needed for erection and dismantling of the wind turbine.
•	transports from intermediates to the manufacturer and transports from the manufacturer to the construction site (default values) along with transport of the excavated mass for the foundation 
This dataset doesn't include:
•	the connection to the grid, which is modelled in a separate dataset
•	the operation and maintenance of the fully finished wind power plant. It is assumed that all parts will hold for the lifetime of 20 years and don't have to be replaced
•	auxiliary materials
•	transport of materials that go potentially to recycling
category: C:Manufacturing/28:Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c./281:Manufacture of general-purpose machinery/2811:Manufacture of engines and turbines, except aircraft, vehicle and cycle eng

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The wind turbine has been produced since 2013, the development of the invetory took place in 2022.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The manufacturer of the wind turbine is located in Germany.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The inventory is based on a small-scale wind turbine with 6 kW nominal power produced in Germany.;Technical characteristics:;•	Horizontal-axis technology, three rotor blades;•	Nominal power output: 6 kW;•	Direct-driven permanent magnet generator;•	Tower height: 18m with reinforced concrete foundation;•	Lifetime expectation: 20 years;•	Rotor diameter: 4,5 m;•	Nominal wind speed: 12,5 m/s;•	Protection method for high wind speeds: vertical positioning of rotor axis;;Moving parts of the wind turbine are the following: ;•	Rotor: rotor blades; rotor hub; mounting materials; total weight: 24 kg;•	Nacelle: bearing/joint for azimuth and vertical orientation (vertical orientation for safety position); tail fin for azimuth orientation; sliding contact for electricity transmission; housing; total weight: 95 kg;•	Generator: direct-driven permanent magnet generator; total weight: 60 kg;;Fixed parts of the wind turbine are the following:;•	Electric and electronic equipment: cables from nacelle to bottom of tower;  Inverter including steel housing for weather protection, total weight: 75 kg;•	Tower: zinced, conical steel tube with 18 m height; lightning protection; total weight: 1047 kg;•	Foundation: steel anchor embedded in the foundation for mounting the tower; concrete and reinforcement; total weight: 391 kg (steel) + concrete (9 m³);;Providing processes for flows have been chosen under spatial consideration with the production site of the turbine located in Germany. If providing processes do not contain transport activities, European average transport distances have been added.;;Literature sources:;[1] Burger, Bastian & Bauer, Christian. Windkraft. ecoinvent report No. 6-XIII. Dübendorf, 2007. URL: http://windland.ch/doku_wind/06_XIII_Windkraft.pdf, last checked at 14.12.2021.;[2] Borken-Kleefeld, Jens. Default transport data per commodity group for the US and EU27 – Methodology and notes on data for ecoinvent. ecoinvent Centre. Zürich, 2012.;[3] Kouloumpis, Victor; Sobolewski, Robert A.; Yan, Xiaoyu. Performance and life cycle assessment of a small scale vertical axis wind turbine. in Journal of Cleaner Production 247, 2020, article 119520.;;Further description on the creation of the LCI-data can be found in the following document:;Knausenberger, Kai. Erarbeitung der Datengrundlage zur Einbindung von Kleinwindenergieanlagen in ökobilanzbasierte Energiesystemmodelle. master-thesis. Hochschule Pforzheim. Pforzheim, 2022.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
All data is specific for the 6 kW small-scale wind turbine.
The steel anchor embedded in the foundation and the amount of reinforcing steel are linear scaled from source [1] by foundation volume. The inverter is linear scaled from source [3] by nominal power.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: primary data provided by manufacturer, literature, estimations
